The claim is made by the Economic Freedo: EFF), a South African political party, in their election manifesto.
The claim is fact: checked by Africa Check, an independent and non-partisan organization that assesses claims made in the public arena.
The claim states that close to 40: of South Africans who need jobs are unemployed, meaning that more than nine million South Africans who need jobs and are capable of working cannot find employment.
